text: John Duignan (born 6 January 1946 – 22 March 2019) was a Scottish economist and writer. Duignan was born in Barrhead, Scotland, in a family of eight children. He left school, St Mirin's Academy in Paisley, at age 15 and worked in a blacksmith's workshop, then served an engineering apprenticeship. He worked in both the engineering and construction industries before going to university, where he read Economics and Economic History. Prior to becoming a full-time writer, Duignan lectured in economics, international business, and quantitative methods at the University of the West of Scotland, where he specialised in undergraduate work placement and had been Associate Lecturer at the Surrey European Management School, University of Surrey and visiting lecturer at French business schools and universities, including Montpellier, Toulon, Annecy and Le Havre. Duignan had presented papers at conferences in the UK,ASET Annual Conference, 3 – 5 September 2002, Fitzwilliam College, Cambridge, England, Integrating Work and Learning in Europe, John Duignan and Russell Wardrop, Raising the stakes and making the links: (predicting the impact of a more structured, measurable and reflective approach to work experience.Duignan, J, Lush, D, and Gomez, S (2004). (HERDSA Journal, July 2002); paper delivered at Edith Cowan University, Perth, Western Australia Duignan had one stage play produced (co- written with Ian Donald Cochrane Hopkins), and had work performed on TV and Radio, including Not the Nine O'Clock News and Naked Video. His works of fiction include Skelp the AgedSkelp the Aged (Pegasus, 2016) ,co-written with Ian Donald Cochrane Hopkins,The Buick Stops HereThe Buick Stops Here (Pegasus Elliot Mackenzie Publishers, 2017) ,co-written with Ian Donald Cochrane Hopkins,The Lambshank RedemptionThe Lambshank Redemption (Pegasus Elliot Mackenzie Publishers, 2019) ,co-written with Ian Donald Cochrane Hopkins, and the Gerry Sweeney/Katherine Black trilogy Saving The Last Dance,Saving the Last Dance (Kindle, 2015) Katherine Black Doesn't DanceKatherine Black Doesn't Dance (Cider Apple Press, 2015, available through Kindle) and Things To Do When The Music Stops.Things to do When the Music Stops, (Cider Apple Press, 2016, available through Kindle) Hopkins and Duignan began writing Skelp the Aged as a play, before deciding to make it a novel.. The three novels in the trilogy by Hopkins and Duignan follow hapless anti-heroes Mungo and Ethel Laird, in and out of trouble - and jail - as they struggle to maintain a living as a bookies. His academic books include Quantitative Methods For Business Research Using Microsoft ExcelQuantitative Methods for Business Research using Microsoft Excel (Cengage/Thomson Learning, 2014) in 2014 and A Dictionary of Business Research MethodsA Dictionary of Business Research Methods (Oxford University Press, 2016) in 2016.
